trans-unit.source: Explains how you can use the StorSimple Manager service volume containers page to delete a volume container.
trans-unit.target: Explains how you can use the StorSimple Manager service volume containers page to delete a volume container.

trans-unit.source: On the Devices page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the Volume containers tab.
trans-unit.target: On the Devices page, select the device, double-click it, and then click the Volume containers tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the volume container you want to delete.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume container you want to delete.

trans-unit.source: If a volume container has no associated volumes, then it can be deleted.
trans-unit.target: If a volume container has no associated volumes, then it can be deleted.

trans-unit.source: Click Delete at the bottom of the page to delete this container.
trans-unit.target: Click Delete at the bottom of the page to delete this container.

trans-unit.source: This will delete the volume container.
trans-unit.target: This will delete the volume container.

trans-unit.source: If the volume container has associated volumes, you will first need to take those volumes offline by following the steps in <linkText>Take a volume offline</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If the volume container has associated volumes, you will first need to take those volumes offline by following the steps in <linkText>Take a volume offline</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After the volumes are offline, you can delete them.
trans-unit.target: After the volumes are offline, you can delete them.

trans-unit.source: When the volume container has no associated volumes, delete the volume container as described above.
trans-unit.target: When the volume container has no associated volumes, delete the volume container as described above.
